title: Start now and live healthy
text:
Eat healthy and live long
Living healthy is a struggle for many young adults, the youth is not informed on how unhealthy lifestyle can affect their lives, Khayakazi Mabefu is a young lady aged 22, living in CPUT residence in Cape Town, came to study in 2013, she just felt sick in 12 th march 2015, she consulted a doctor only to find out that she was diabetic and that is when she had to learn to eat and live a healthy life style.
Indeed it was not easy as she was used on eating junk food with lot of sugar, she says “eating healthy needs a disciplined person, discipline means you do what you have to do when you don’t want to do it” , her parents were shocked when she told them that she was diabetic at her young age, having a lot of life ahead, “I had to accept the sickness and continue with treatment, and also I had to lose some kilos because I was getting bigger in size as well” said Khayakazi Mabefu .
Living healthy is a decision that one can take concerning their lives, it starts with very small things and there more you become dedicated there more you become healthy and the more you live. Doctors usually say one apple a day can keep you away from hospital and exercising is not lifting weights but a walk rather than a drive is a good start.
Khayakazi said “ it doesn’t go with weather I feel like eating healthy or what not but doctors commanded me to do so”. she was instructed to stay away from acid drink and take juice instead, people should consider these things before they get sick, because junk food is not good at all.
Phelokazi stone who is a young lady from CPUT said “we do want to be healthy but this healthy food is expensive and most of us we come from disadvantaged communities, and another thing is even when we can afford we struggle because we used on eating junk food, however we are willing to change than to die young”.
Balancing food is good for everyone, start now and you’ll get used to it, the way you live can affect your life positively or negatively, stay healthy and live long.
